text: If memory serves I responded to Ingraham by asking why—if Distort was such a fearless cultural warrior—he made his girlfriend do the dirty work of sticking up for him in public.
author: Gladwell

text: How do I know this? Because one of my very first published pieces of journalism—in 1985!—made fun of D’Souza. You know who wrote in to complain? His then girlfriend Laura Ingraham. The conspiracy of dunces runs VERY deep.
author: Gladwell

text: Hilarious Dinesh D’Souza fact. In college his nickname was Distort D’Newsa. This was 35 years ago. People got wise to him a long time ago.
author: Gladwell

text: Malcolm X. I don’t think so. Malcolm Brogdon. Not a chance. Malcolm Jamal Warner. Totally.

text: We had a Doberman mix named Spassky who would run 8 miles with me after school then accompany my dad on a one hour walk. I feel she could have also broken 4 minutes too. But only if she wasn’t distracted by rabbits.

text: Crucial details on the historic human/dog sub 4 minute mile. Apparently the human was holding Bailey back.

text: Due to the, er, uncertainty over some previously scheduled speakers, I will be subbing in at The New Yorker Festival! There is zero truth to the rumor I will take this opportunity to further pursue the dinner party question. :-)
author: Gladwell

text: Joe McCarthy was done in when he was confronted by someone with intelligence and guts, before a live audience. Sometimes a platform is actually a gallows.
author: Gladwell

text: Huh. Call me old-fashioned. But I would have thought that the point of a festival of ideas was to expose the audience to ideas. If you only invite your friends over, it’s called a dinner party.
author: Gladwell

text: Correct. I am the EXACT target audience for this.
author: Gladwell

text: I finally make it onto the world’s greatest letters-to-the-editor page. My life’s work is complete. @CARandDRIVER

text: The last episode of season 3 is out! Elvis, some magic from Jack White and the heartbreaking Kaci Bolls. Keep  Kleenex handy!! I think it’s one of the best we’ve ever done. Thanks to everyone who who listened!

text: I’m in tears
author: Gladwell

text: Here is a lovely tribute to my father, Graham Gladwell, who passed away last spring. “Fields Notes,” page 13. My favorite line: “He was perhaps the most open-minded academic I have ever encountered.” I try to live up to his standard every day. http://www.fields.utoronto.ca/sites/default/files/Fields%20Notes%20Summer%202017.pdf …

text: Nick Thompson and I in part two of our epic (well, endless) discussion of the World Track championships.
author: Gladwell

text: In honor of Usain Bolt's magnificent win today at the world track championships, time for a little national pride.
author: Gladwell

text: Creating a sense of entitlement costs way more than you'd think.
author: Gladwell

text: If we don't subsidize Ivy Leaguers now, how will they learn how to ask for a bail out later?
author: Gladwell

text: Ivy League students are on the government free lunch program--only the lunch is at Nobu.
author: Gladwell

text: Value of Annual per student taxpayer subsidies at Harvard: $48,000. Yale: $69,000. Princeton: $105,000.
author: Gladwell

text: Annual per student taxpayer grants and subsidies at a typical state college like Penn State: $9000.
author: Gladwell

text: Total yearly value of taxpayer grants, loans, and tax subsidies per student at a typical community college: $2k to $6k
author: Gladwell

text: A fascinating look at how taxpayer subsidies for higher Ed vary by institution. http://nexusresearch.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/Rich_Schools_Poor_Students.pdf …
author: Gladwell

text: Does this mean that if I spend four years at a hedge fund I get a Yale degree?
author: Gladwell

text: Tax deductible self-pleasuring. TDSP. I believe that's the technical term.
author: Gladwell

text: Masturdation
author: Gladwell

text: It's masturbation. Only with money.
author: Gladwell

text: If a hedge fund guy gives millions to the Yale endowment and then gets millions back for managing the same endowment, what is that called?
author: Gladwell

text: All the Wall Street analysts are in agreement: time for Yale to shed the declining legacy educating business.
author: Gladwell

text: Why doesn't Yale spin off its university division and concentrate on its core money management business?
author: Gladwell

text: I was going to donate money to Yale. But maybe it makes more sense to mail a check directly to the hedge fund of my choice.
author: Gladwell

text: Yale's endowment spent $480 million paying its hedge fund managers last year and $170 million on its students.
author: Gladwell

text: This seems reasonable.
author: Gladwell

author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield surely you are working on another book . . .
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield i need to ask a serious question before we wrap things up . . .
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield Of course you are! You and one million other delusional Ontarians. :-)
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield i can reliably sleep in.
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield Intervals this evening with my track club. I actually rest all the time. It's why i became a writer. Only profession where. .
author: Gladwell

text: @MattSNZ @Cmdr_Hadfield We can put a man on the moon. But we can't play great hockey in Toronto. Something is amiss with the universe!
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield Now that we're being Canadians, shouldn't we discuss your (our) hapless Maple Leafs?
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield i won't rest until all famous canadians are recognized as canadians.
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield neil young has made great music in FIVE decades. i would take his advice seriously. do you think Americans realize he's cdn?
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield so i'm always taken by surprise. how does writing music make you wonder about that?
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield the thing i've learned is that there isn't a strong correlation between what I like and what readers like. . .
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield @canhowie 10k hours was developed for chess players and classical composers. yes. an astronaut? just a wee bit more complex.
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield It's almost like we expect astronauts to be robots. maybe that's what makes your book so compelling
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield i'm ALWAYS surprised. whats I found fascinating was that i realized i'd never thought about the person behind the astronaut.
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield the impression i got from your book was that your head was already pretty clear!
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield I found your book really wonderful. btw. were you surprised by its success?
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield I write in cafes mostly. And then wander around on my bicycle. We might have different excitement profiles
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield Although you grew up in Milton. Which those of us in Elmira consider a steaming metropolis
author: Gladwell

text: @Cmdr_Hadfield Im in New York! wait. aren't we going to talk about our shared southern Ontario rural upbringing?
author: Gladwell

text: He wrote t"An Astronauts Guide to Life on Earth." Which I wished I'd written--except that I would have had to be an astronaut first.
author: Gladwell

text: Hello all. I'm doing a twitter chat with fellow Canadian Chris Hadfield (@cmdr_Hadfield) starting in 10mins.
author: Gladwell

text: And while I'm self-promoting, I ran a master's pr at the Brooklyn Crit 5k this weekend. 18:15. Not bad for an old man!
author: Gladwell

text: My latest for the New Yorker, on auto safety. The Engineer's Lament.
author: Gladwell

text: Also, on the subject of celeb encounters, who ran up alongside me last week in LA? Miling great Will Leer. He slowed down. I sped (way) up.
author: Gladwell

text: The incomparable Meb and one of his biggest groupies.
author: Gladwell

text: Fareed Zakaria's new book is brilliant! The case for the liberal arts. http://www.amazon.com/Defense-Liberal-Education-Fareed-Zakaria/dp/0393247686/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1424208798&sr=1-1&keywords=in+defense+of+a+liberal+education …

text: A great video from one of the most brilliant voices in healthcare, Gilbert Welch.
author: Gladwell

text: This is the best thing I've seen on the Brian Williams case. Have we become memory fundamentalists?
author: Gladwell

text: Michael Specter talking sense on vaccine hysteria:
author: Gladwell

text: Cam Levins! Canada's greatest runner! Afro meets Jewfro. #MillroseGames
author: Gladwell

text: David Olds makes me an honorary "Fluffy Bunny" after the Santa Monica 5k. It's all downhill from here.
author: Gladwell

text: Michael Specter's piece in the latest New Yorker on GMO is really really good.
author: Gladwell

text: My latest from The New Yorker. On the mafia, Alice Goffman ' s incredible new book and crime as upward mobility.
author: Gladwell

text: My latest from the New Yorker, on the Philby spy case.
author: Gladwell

text: Out today: the paperback of one of my favorite books of the last year. Charles Belfoure's "The Paris Architect."
author: Gladwell

text: BREAKING: Amazon breaks silence on Hachette dispute. This is unreal.
author: Gladwell

text: I'm doing a Google hangout with TD Jakes, starting in ten minutes. Come and join in!
author: Gladwell

text: Hollywood should make romances this good! Heart-breaking video from the NYT:
author: Gladwell

text: I'm live on reddit answering questions. Jim us!
author: Gladwell

text: A group of Canadian grad students have created a website that elegantly summarizes scientific findings. It's genius.
author: Gladwell

text: For those of us who can't get enough Slate (and I count myself among them) there is now slate plus. check it out!
author: Gladwell

text: Jonah Lehrer is back with a new blog. It is well worth reading. Welcome back Jonah.
author: Gladwell

text: @owenhumphreys1 great. Give me a shout.
author: Gladwell

text: @owenhumphreys1 hello there owen. I'd love to buy a print of your marvelous farah bekele hg photo. Can you email me at gladwell@gmail.com?
author: Gladwell

text: What went wrong at Waco. My latest for the New Yorker. http://m.newyorker.com/reporting/2014/03/31/140331fa_fact_gladwell?currentPage=all …
author: Gladwell

text: In honor of being on the Dave Hill show tonite, I'm passing on evidence of his genius: "@mrdavehill: Making toast. Blood everywhere."
author: Gladwell

text: Last week I meet the 'Hoff. Now a judge sentences a woman to read David and Goliath. My cup runneth over. http://www.quillandquire.com/blog/index.php/book-news/jailed-environmental-activist-rebecca-rubin-sentenced-to-read-malcolm-gladwell/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=jailed-environmental-activist-rebecca-rubin-sentenced-to-read-malcolm-gladwell …

text: Here is the schedule for round two of the David and Goliath book tour. http://gladwellbooks.com/events.html
author: Gladwell

text: David and Goliath book tour part two! Ann Arbor tonite. Atlanta Wednesday, Minneapolis Thursday, Milwaukee Friday, Dallas next Monday. Come!
author: Gladwell

text: Chris Chataway, who paced Roger Bannister's 4 minute mile, has died: ran 5:48 mile at age 64 and 49:08 10k at age 73. Unreal.
author: Gladwell

text: My greatest moment ever.
author: Gladwell

text: I'm giving a talk on Tuesday in Berlin at the KulturKaufhaus at 7pm. Come! http://www.kulturkaufhaus.de/de/veranstaltungen/events/writers-series-dussmann-english-bookshop-hosts-the-american-academy-in-berlin/ …
author: Gladwell

text: Stanford alum Garrett Heath just beat greats Kiprop and Bekele. In a world where running mattered, there would be riots in palo alto 2nite.
author: Gladwell

text: The Moth's collection of "true" stories hits the New York Times bestseller list! Congrats. http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/1401311113/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?qid=1389211703&sr=1-1 …

text: The next Usain Bolt? Make sure you watch this til the end. Unreal. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=En3wfpJagQk …

A chat with one of my academic heros, Adam 
Grant:

text: Toronto Globe and Mail names "David and Goliath" to its 2013 top ten list: "an inspiring, and surprisingly moral, call to arms."

text: @CharlesBelfoure #parisarchitect was the best novel I read all year. Thank you.

text: @IAmMaggieMull since you make me laugh at least once a day, I should be thanking you!
author: Gladwell

text: Why Lake Bell's "In a World" deserves Oscar consideration. I completely agree.

author: Gladwell

text: Security at Newark Airport just patted down my hair. Can't figure out if that's racial profiling.
author: Gladwell

text: I shared the stage tonight in London with @thestaves. Coolest and best band in Britain. It was an honor.
author: Gladwell

text: The great Stephen Fry stops by for a chat!
author: Gladwell

text: Attention Torontonians: I'm signing books tonight at seven at Indigo in the Manulife center. @indigogreenroom
author: Gladwell

text: Finale of the brilliant Children's Hospital tomorrow at midnight! More proof of @lakebell's genius. http://video.adultswim.com/childrens-hospital/ …

author: Gladwell

text: Tonight on PBS at 8: premiere of Skip Gates's fabulous series--"The African Americans: Many Rivers to Cross." better than the world series!
author: Gladwell

text: a3: to quote Billy Bragg: "you poor take courage; you rich take care." foregone conclusions are not always so foregone after all #MashReads
author: Gladwell

text: .@michaelkriak I cannot say that being on the side of a bus is a fulfillment of a lifetime ambition. #MashReads
author: Gladwell

text: .@corlugs Hugely excited for Dublin! I am working on my Irish accent as we speak. (It's not bad!). #MashReads
author: Gladwell

text: .@KingYuda  if everyone else wears one hat, best to wear many. if everyone else wears many, wear one. #MashReads
author: Gladwell

text: .@northshoretrack i used to run in karhu, because who doesn't love a finnish shoe? now i'm all about brooks. #MashReads
author: Gladwell

text: .@alexcequea when you write for the New Yorker they give you so much space you HAVE to blend stories with stats. :-)
author: Gladwell

text: A2: I was going to do an chapter on ADD and creativity. For research, i had my prefrontal cortex disabled. i was much improved #mashreads
author: Gladwell

text: @claycourville greatest upset of all time? let's continue in the canadian vein: the war of 1812 of course! too bad we had to give ohio back
author: Gladwell

text: A1: I'm Canadian. I ALWAYS identify with the underdog! You try living next to America sometime. #MashReads
author: Gladwell
